title: How much weight is lost on elliptical machine? - Quora

response.answer_text: You’re doing it wrong For starters: “I eat around 1000–1200 calories a day”…”I am eating healthy” You’re either lying about the first statement or deceiving yourself in the second statement. Eating 1000–1200 calories a day is not healthy, even for your size, especially if you are doing intense exercise.  Now, with regards to your question…you don’t really lose weight exercising. I mean, once I went running for an hour when the “real-feel” temperature was 104. I weighed myself before and after and I’d lost about 15 pounds of sweat. All that weight came back after I rehydrated. You lose weight with your eating, by eating at a deficit. Too much exercise and an extreme deficit like you’re using will lead to weight gain long term. You’ll crash your weight, start eating more and gain your weight back, and more, quickly. The elliptical doesn’t cause you to immediately lose weight outside of water weight from sweating. It can help with your caloric deficit as well as build up muscles in your legs and core. To directly answer the question: There is no way of knowing exactly how much weight you’ll lose from water weight, it depends on how long you do it and how hard you go, even then, it’s only water weight.
